articles.title: Controversial US study on hepatitis B vaccines in Africa is cancelled
articles.summary:
$1.6m project drew outrage over ethical questions about withholding vaccines proven to prevent disease

The controversial US-funded study on hepatitis B vaccines among newborns in Guinea-Bissau has been halted, according to Yap Boum, a senior official at the Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC).

“The study has been cancelled,” Boum told journalists at a press conference on Thursday morning.

articles.title: Pesticides may drastically shorten fish lifespans, study finds
articles.summary:
Even low levels of widely used agricultural chemicals were linked to accelerated ageing, research suggests

The lifespan of fish appears to be drastically reduced by pesticides, a study has found.

Even low levels of common agricultural pesticides can stunt the long-term lifespan of fish, according to research led by Jason Rohr, a biologist at the University of Notre Dame in Indiana.

Hare also gives her top tips for getting better sleep in 2026

articles.original_description:

Jillian Ambrose, the Guardian energy correspondent, explains to Ian Sample the appeal of Venezuelan oil to the US, how easy it is to extract and what the latest action tells us about Trump’s energy strategy

articles.title: The man taking over the Large Hadron Collider – only to switch it off
articles.summary: Марк Томпсон, профессор Кембриджского университета, становится новым генеральным директором CERN. Он возглавит организацию с целью построения нового, более мощного коллайдера для замены Большого адронного коллайдера. Это решение означает, что при его участии старый коллайдер будет выключен ради исследований более глубоких тайн вселенной.
articles.original_description:
Next head of Cern backs massive replacement for world’s largest machine to investigate mysteries of the universe

Mark Thomson, a professor of experimental particle physics at the University of Cambridge, has landed one of the most coveted jobs in global science. But it is hard not to wonder, when looked at from a certain angle, whether he has taken one for the team.

On 1 January, Thomson takes over as the director general of Cern, the multi-Nobel prizewinning nuclear physics labor

articles.title: Nasa readies its most powerful rocket for round-the-moon flight
articles.summary:
Artemis II mission could launch on 6 February, sending astronauts on a 685,000-mile journey

Nasa is preparing to roll out its most powerful rocket yet before a mission to send astronauts around the moon and back again for the first time in more than 50 years.

The Artemis II mission is scheduled to launch from Kennedy Space Center in Florida as early as 6 February, taking its crew on a 685,000-mile round trip that will end about 10 days later with a splashdown in the Pacific Ocean.

articles.title: Tiny earthquakes are revealing a dangerous secret beneath California
articles.summary: Ученые обнаружили скрытую и сложную сейсмическую зону на стыке разлома Сан-Андреас и субдукционной зоны Каскадия в Северной Калифорнии. Их открытие стало возможным благодаря отслеживанию цепочек незаметных для человека микроземлетрясений. Эти данные позволяют лучше понять структуру одного из самых опасных сейсмических регионов Северной Америки.
articles.original_description: Scientists are uncovering a hidden and surprisingly complex earthquake zone beneath Northern California by tracking swarms of tiny earthquakes that are far too weak to feel. These faint tremors are revealing what lies beneath the surface where the San Andreas fault meets the Cascadia subduction zone, one of the most dangerous seismic regions in North America.

articles.title: How scientists are turning thyme into precision medicine
articles.summary: Thyme extract is packed with health-promoting compounds, but it is difficult to control and easy to waste. Researchers created a new technique that traps tiny amounts of the extract inside microscopic capsules, preventing evaporation and irritation. The method delivers consistent nanodoses and could eventually be used in medicines or food products. It may also work for many other natural extracts.

articles.title: AI maps the hidden forces shaping cancer survival worldwide
articles.summary: Researchers have turned artificial intelligence into a powerful new lens for understanding why cancer survival rates differ so dramatically around the world. By analyzing cancer data and health system information from 185 countries, the AI model highlights which factors, such as access to radiotherapy, universal health coverage, and economic strength, are most closely linked to better survival in each nation.

articles.title: A routine eye treatment is raising new concerns for glaucoma patients
articles.summary: Новое исследование предупреждает о риске повреждения популярных имплантов при глаукоме из-за использования масляных глазных мазей. Ученые обнаружили, что мази впитываются в материал импланта, вызывая его набухание и разрыв, особенно при прямом контакте. Это ставит под сомнение безопасность стандартного послеоперационного ухода за глазами.
articles.original_description: A new study warns that a widely used eye ointment can damage a popular glaucoma implant. Researchers found that oil-based ointments can be absorbed into the implant’s material, causing it to swell and sometimes break. Patient cases showed damage only when the implant directly contacted the ointment, a result confirmed in lab experiments. The findings raise concerns about standard post-surgery eye care.

articles.title: Scientists found hidden synapse hotspots in the teen brain
articles.summary: Scientists have discovered that the adolescent brain does more than prune old connections. During the teen years, it actively builds dense new clusters of synapses in specific parts of neurons. These clusters emerge only in adolescence and may help shape higher-level thinking. When the process is disrupted, it could play a role in conditions like schizophrenia.

articles.title: NASA brings Crew-11 home early in rare medical evacuation
articles.summary: SpaceX Crew-11 splashed down safely in the Pacific after more than five months in orbit aboard the International Space Station. The four astronauts completed over 140 experiments and traveled nearly 71 million miles around Earth. NASA brought the crew home earlier than planned due to a medical concern, with officials confirming the affected crew member is stable. The mission underscores how quickly today’s space programs can adapt while keeping astronauts safe.

articles.summary: Engineers have created a device that generates incredibly tiny, earthquake-like vibrations on a microchip—and it could transform future electronics. Using a new kind of “phonon laser,” the team can produce ultra-fast surface waves that already play a hidden role in smartphones, GPS systems, and wireless tech. articles.title: An endocrinologist tried a new weight loss approach and it worked
articles.summary: A simple change in how primary care clinics approach weight management is delivering big public health wins. PATHWEIGH lets patients openly request help and gives doctors the tools to focus entire visits on weight care. In a massive real-world trial, the program halted population weight gain and increased access to obesity treatment. Now, health systems across the U.S. are lining up to adopt it.

articles.title: Scientists are rethinking bamboo as a powerful new superfood
articles.summary: Bamboo shoots may be far more than a crunchy side dish. A comprehensive review found they can help control blood sugar, support heart and gut health, and reduce inflammation and oxidative stress. Laboratory and human studies also suggest bamboo may promote beneficial gut bacteria and reduce toxic compounds in cooked foods. However, bamboo must be pre-boiled to avoid natural toxins.

articles.title: Researchers found a tipping point for video gaming and health
articles.summary: Moderate video gaming appears harmless, but heavy gaming may take a toll on young people’s health. Researchers found that students gaming more than 10 hours a week had worse diets, higher body weight, and poorer sleep than lighter gamers. Below that level, health outcomes were largely similar. The findings suggest balance, not abstinence, is key.

articles.title: The breakthrough that makes robot faces feel less creepy
articles.summary: Humans pay enormous attention to lips during conversation, and robots have struggled badly to keep up. A new robot developed at Columbia Engineering learned realistic lip movements by watching its own reflection and studying human videos online. This allowed it to speak and sing with synchronized facial motion, without being explicitly programmed. Researchers believe this breakthrough could help robots finally cross the uncanny valley.

articles.title: Scientists found the soil secret that doubles forest regrowth
articles.summary: New research shows tropical forests can recover twice as fast after deforestation when their soils contain enough nitrogen. Scientists followed forest regrowth across Central America for decades and found that nitrogen plays a decisive role in how quickly trees return. Faster regrowth also means more carbon captured from the atmosphere. The study points to smarter reforestation strategies that work with nature rather than relying on fertilizers.

articles.title: Stretchable OLED displays take a big leap forward
articles.summary: Учёные создали новый OLED-дизайн, способный значительно растягиваться, не теряя яркости, благодаря комбинации эффективных светоизлучающих материалов и прозрачных электродов на основе MXene. Технология прошла испытания, подтвердившие сохранение яркости даже после многократного растяжения. Это открывает перспективы для создания гибких экранов для носимых устройств и датчиков здоровья.
articles.original_description: A new OLED design can stretch dramatically while staying bright, solving a problem that has long limited flexible displays. The breakthrough comes from pairing a highly efficient light-emitting material with tough, transparent MXene-based electrodes. Tests showed the display kept most of its brightness even after repeated stretching. The technology could power future wearable screens and on-skin health sensors.

articles.title: Fewer offspring, longer life: The hidden rule of mammal aging
articles.summary: A large international study reveals that mammals tend to live longer when reproduction is suppressed. On average, lifespan increases by about 10 percent, though the reasons differ for males and females. Castrated males avoid the harmful effects of testosterone, while females gain longevity by sidestepping the intense physical demands of pregnancy and nursing. The results underscore a powerful biological trade-off between making offspring and staying alive longer.

articles.title: Statins may help almost everyone with type 2 diabetes live longer
articles.summary: New research suggests statins may protect adults with type 2 diabetes regardless of how low their predicted heart risk appears. In a large UK study, statin use was linked to fewer deaths and major cardiac events across all risk levels. Even those labeled “low risk” benefited, challenging long-held assumptions about who should receive preventive therapy. Side effects were rare and generally mild.

articles.title: One protein may decide whether brain chemistry heals or harms
articles.summary: Белок триптофан, критически важный для регуляции настроения и энергии, с возрастом или при неврологических заболеваниях может перенаправляться к вредным продуктам обмена. Это нарушение вызывает негативные последствия, включая ухудшение памяти, проблемы со сном и эмоциональную нестабильность. Ученые изучают механизмы этого процесса для поиска новых терапевтических стратегий.
articles.original_description: Tryptophan does far more than help us sleep—it fuels brain chemistry, energy production, and mood-regulating neurotransmitters. But as the brain ages or develops neurological disease, this delicate system goes awry, pushing tryptophan toward harmful byproducts linked to memory loss, mood changes, and sleep problems.

articles.title: Vitamin A may be helping cancer hide from the immune system
articles.summary: Ученые обнаружили, что производное витамина A способно подавлять иммунитет, что позволяет опухолям скрываться от атак и снижает эффективность противораковых вакцин. Для решения этой проблемы был разработан препарат, блокирующий данную молекулярную цепочку. В доклинических исследованиях он значительно усилил иммунный ответ и замедлил рост раковых клеток.
articles.original_description: A vitamin A byproduct has been found to quietly disarm the immune system, allowing tumors to evade attack and weakening cancer vaccines. Scientists have now developed a drug that shuts down this pathway, dramatically boosting immune responses and slowing cancer growth in preclinical studies.

articles.title: Scientists “resurrect” ancient cannabis enzymes with medical promise
articles.summary: Scientists have uncovered how cannabis evolved the ability to make its most famous compounds—THC, CBD, and CBC—by recreating ancient enzymes that existed millions of years ago. These early enzymes were multitaskers, capable of producing several cannabinoids at once, before evolution fine-tuned them into today’s highly specialized forms. By “resurrecting” these long-lost enzymes in the lab, researchers showed how cannabis chemistry became more precise over time—and discovered something unexpected

articles.title: A deadly chemical frozen in ice may have sparked life on Earth
articles.summary: Hydrogen cyanide, a toxic chemical, may have helped spark the chemistry that led to life. When frozen, it forms crystals with highly reactive surfaces that can drive unusual chemical reactions, even in extreme cold. These reactions could produce more reactive molecules that pave the way for life’s basic ingredients. The findings suggest frozen worlds may be more chemically active than once thought.

articles.title: Those strange red dots in James Webb images finally have an explanation
articles.summary: For years, strange red dots in James Webb images left scientists puzzled. New research shows they are young black holes hidden inside dense clouds of gas, glowing as they devour their surroundings. These black holes are smaller than expected but grow rapidly, shedding light on how supermassive black holes appeared so early in cosmic history. The finding reveals a violent and messy phase of the universe’s youth.

articles.summary: Соглашение о защите Амазонки, действовавшее 20 лет, находится на грани развала. Бразилия и Перу, основные участники договора, обвиняют друг друга в невыполнении обязательств, что ставит под угрозу сохранение экосистемы.

articles.title: After one year of Trump, is anything left of the American Climate Corps?
articles.summary: Американский Корпус климата, созданный при Байдене, за первый год администрации Трампа столкнулся с катастрофическим сокращением финансирования и свертыванием программ. Из-за этого инициатива, нацеленная на борьбу с изменением климата и обучение зеленым профессиям, фактически прекратила свою деятельность.

articles.title: States say they need more help replacing lead pipes. Congress may cut the funding instead.
articles.summary: Штаты США сообщают, что им требуется больше помощи для замены свинцовых труб, однако Конгресс рассматривает возможное сокращение финансирования на эти цели.

articles.title: Trump’s EPA could limit its own ability to use new science to strengthen air pollution rules
articles.summary: Агентство по охране окружающей среды США (EPA) при администрации Трампа рассматривает правило, которое ограничит использование новых научных данных для обоснования ужесточения нормативов загрязнения воздуха. Предлагаемые изменения могут потребовать публикации исходных данных и повторного анализа, что может замедлить принятие мер по защите общественного здоровья.

articles.title: How community solar turned a Superfund site into savings in Illinois
articles.summary: В штате Иллинойс на месте бывшего сверхзагрязненного участка (Superfund) построили солнечную электростанцию. Эта проект обеспечивает экологически чистой энергией местных жителей и приносит им экономию на счетах за электричество.

articles.title: Mobile homes already have huge utility bills. Congress may make it worse.
articles.summary: В Конгрессе США рассматривается законопроект, который может привести к росту платы за коммунальные услуги для жителей мобильных домов. Это произойдет за счет отмены льгот для коммунальных компаний, поставляющих энергию в такие поселки. Уже сейчас расходы на ЖКХ являются серьезным финансовым бременем для этой группы населения.

articles.title: How Chevron played the long game in Venezuela
articles.summary: Компания Chevron проводила в Венесуэле долгосрочную стратегию, сохраняя присутствие в стране, несмотря на санкции и политические риски. Благодаря этому она смогла возобновить добычу и транспортировку нефти, получив выгоды от ослабления конкурентов и смягчения Вашингтоном ограничений.

articles.title: The Miccosukee Tribe blocked Alligator Alcatraz. Then Trump blocked a bill to return their land.
articles.summary: Племя Миккосуки выступило против проекта «Аллигатор Алькатрас», после чего администрация Трампа заблокировала законопроект о возврате земель племени.

articles.title: Trump just took his most dramatic step yet against global climate action
articles.summary: Президент США Дональд Трамп инициировал процедуру выхода страны из Парижского климатического соглашения. Этот шаг стал наиболее радикальным действием администрации в направлении свертывания глобальной политики по борьбе с изменением климата. США являются второй по величине экономикой мира, что может серьезно подорвать эффективность международных договоренностей.

articles.title: In 2025, the US suffered a billion-dollar disaster every 10 days
articles.summary: В 2025 году США ежедекадно постигал катастрофический ущерб, исчисляемый миллиардами долларов. По данным Национального управления океанических и атмосферных исследований, число таких стихийных бедствий возросло по сравнению с прошлыми годами. Учащение экстремальных явлений связывают с изменением климата.

articles.title: Trump invaded Venezuela to restore an oil industry he helped destroy
articles.summary: Президент Трамп оправдывает военное вторжение в Венесуэлу необходимостью восстановить нефтяную отрасль страны. При этом отмечается, что эта отрасль ранее была разрушена из-за введенных США санкций и внешнеполитических действий самого Трампа.

articles.title: Texas clears the way for petrochemical expansion as experts warn of health risks
articles.summary: Власти Техаса одобряют расширение нефтехимической промышленности, несмотря на предупреждения экспертов о рисках для здоровья. Решение может привести к увеличению выбросов вредных веществ в регионах, где уже зафиксированы проблемы с качеством воздуха.

articles.title: Why forcing people to go green can backfire
articles.summary: Принуждение к экологичному поведению может вызвать реактивное сопротивление, когда люди отстаивают свою свободу выбора. Это приводит к обратному эффекту, снижая мотивацию к экологическим действиям и сводя на нет усилия по охране окружающей среды.

Ее глазное яблоко было частично разрушено, но инъекция помогла восстановить структуру и функцию глаза. Лечение стало прорывом в офтальмологии и может изменить подход к терапии подобных заболеваний.

articles.original_description: After receiving a diagnosis of terminal cancer, he used his experience in public relations to draw attention to the skyrocketing cost of medication.

articles.title: E.P.A. to Stop Considering Lives Saved by Limiting Air Pollution
articles.summary: Агентство по охране окружающей среды США (E.P.A.) отказалось от учёта экономической ценности спасённых жизней при установлении норм загрязнения воздуха. Теперь при расчёте экологических стандартов будут учитываться только затраты для промышленности. Решение основано на внутренних документах ведомства.
articles.original_description: In a reversal, the agency plans to calculate only the cost to industry when setting pollution limits, and not the monetary value of saving human lives, documents show.

articles.title: F.D.A. Decisions on Abortion Pill Were Based on Science, New Analysis Finds
articles.summary: Анализ более чем 5000 страниц документов FDA за 12 лет показал, что решения по препарату мифепристон основывались на научных данных. Руководство агентства практически всегда следовало рекомендациям учёных, подтверждая обоснованность своих решений.
articles.original_description: A study of more than 5,000 pages of agency documents on mifepristone over 12 years found that agency leaders almost always followed the evidence-based recommendations of scientists.

articles.title: Jirdes Winther Baxter, 101, Dies; Last Survivor of Epidemic in Alaska
articles.summary: Скончалась Джирдес Винтр Бакстер, последняя выжившая из эпидемии дифтерии в Номе, Аляска. Её спасение стало возможным благодаря знаменитому собачьему перегоночному пробегу протяжённостью почти 700 миль, доставившему жизненно важную сыворотку.
articles.original_description: An outbreak of diphtheria inspired a celebrated sled dog relay of nearly 700 miles to deliver lifesaving serum to the remote town of Nome.

Предлагаемые изменения вызывают дискуссии о балансе между личной свободой и общественным здоровьем.
articles.original_description: Comments by Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his allies suggest the revised schedule may presage an approach to immunization that prizes individual autonomy and downplays scientific expertise.

articles.title: The crying game: what Hamnet’s grief-porn debate says about women, cinema – and enormous hawks
articles.summary: В статье обсуждается дебаты вокруг так называемого «гриф-порно» на примере произведений «Hamnet» и «H Is for Hawk», где переплетаются темы утраты, птиц и эмоционального опыта женщин. Автор анализирует, почему реакция на трагедию в кино и литературе может восприниматься как искусственная или эксплуататорская, и кого винить в отсутствии эмоционального отклика у зрителя. В центре внимания — вопрос о границах между искренним искусством о горе и его эстетизацией.
articles.original_description:
Hamnet and H Is for Hawk fuse themes of loss, birds and elemental female emotion. But whose fault is it if you remain dry-eyed?

‘Is it porn or is it art?” A familiar, even dated question where nudity is involved, and (forgive thumbnail) pretty well-resolved– which is to say: we let the tastemakers decide, and it tips the scale towards “art” if one or both protagonists are not that good-looking.

articles.title: Carrick has dream start as Mbeumo and Dorgu give Manchester United derby delight
articles.summary:
On 65 minutes Michael Carrick’s second tenure went electric as Manchester United scored a classic breakaway goal by Bryan Mbeumo that sent the interim head coach berserk in the technical area.

After a clearing Harry Maguire header, the ball evaded Rayan Cherki and Bruno Fernandes galloped forward. He had Amad Diallo to the right and Patrick Dorgu and Mbeumo on the left; United’s streetwise captain delayed the pass, then found the Cameroonian, whose finish beat Gianluigi Donnarumma.
articles.original_description:
On 65 minutes Michael Carrick’s second tenure went electric as Manchester United scored a classic breakaway goal by Bryan Mbeumo that sent the interim head coach berserk in the technical area.

After a clearing Harry Maguire header, the ball evaded Rayan Cherki and Bruno Fernandes galloped forward. He had Amad Diallo to the right and Patrick Dorgu and Mbeumo on the left; United’s streetwise captain delayed the pass, then found the Cameroonian, whose finish beat Gianluigi Donnarumma.

articles.title: Wilson’s last-gasp West Ham winner deepens Frank’s Tottenham crisis
articles.summary:
It was the chant that had simmered for many weeks and there was an inevitability when it was belted out by the Tottenham support at the very last. “Sacked in the morning,” they yelled at Thomas Frank, the frustration unbearable. They have seen enough. In their opinion, the manager has to go.

Whether the club’s board agree is unclear. They know the problems that Frank has faced and continues to face during a season of turmoil and transition. The acid test of nerve is upon them.

Thirty two shots on goal with 11 on target would suggest Liverpool obliged against Burnley, but Anfield still waits for Slot’s side to click.

Liverpool were held to a fourth consecutive Prem

articles.summary: «Челси» прервал серию без побед в Премьер-лиге, одержав волевую победу над «Брентфордом». Решающую роль в матче сыграли Джоау Педро и Коул Палмер, последний из которых реализовал пенальти. Лам Розеньор сохранил спокойствие на скамейке запасных, направляя команду к финальному успеху.
articles.original_description:
As he watched Cole Palmer smash a penalty past Caoimhín Kelleher to secure his first three points at Chelsea, Liam Rosenior may have briefly wondered why such a fuss is made about Premier League management.

The 41-year-old calmly exchanged low fives on the bench with members of his coaching staff before springing to his feet and pointing to his temple, imploring his players to keep their heads and close out the remaining 15 minutes, which they achieved with minimal trouble.
